    • Field Detail

      • DEFAULT_SUPPORTED_KEY_TYPES

        public static final String[] DEFAULT_SUPPORTED_KEY_TYPES
        The key gen types (see KeyGenType that are supported by default. To change this, use setSupportedKeyTypes(List).

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractPkiCredentialContainer

        public AbstractPkiCredentialContainer​(Provider provider)
        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        provider - the provider that is used to create and manage keys

    • Method Detail

      • generateAlias

        protected BigInteger generateAlias()
        Overridable function to generate the unique alias for each generated key.
        Returns:
        BigInteger key alias

      • cleanup

        public void cleanup()
             throws PkiCredentialContainerException
        Traverses through all credentials in the multi credential key store and delets the expired ones.
        Specified by:
        cleanup in interface PkiCredentialContainer
        Throws:
        PkiCredentialContainerException - error performing cleanup

      • isExpired

        protected boolean isExpired​(String alias)
                     throws PkiCredentialContainerException
        Checks if the entry identified with alias is expired.
        Parameters:
        alias - the key entry alias
        Returns:
        true if the entry has expired, and false otherwise
        Throws:
        PkiCredentialContainerException - for errors getting the entry

      • setKeyValidity

        public void setKeyValidity​(Duration keyValidity)
        Assigns the duration for the validity of generated credentials.

        If supplied with null the generated key pairs will never expire. In these cases each generated credential must be manually deleted using PkiCredentialContainer.deleteCredential(String).

        Specified by:
        setKeyValidity in interface PkiCredentialContainer
        Parameters:
        keyValidity - the validity

      • getKeyValidity

        protected Duration getKeyValidity()
        Gets the key validity. A value of null means that credentials never expire.
        Returns:
        the validity, or null

      • setSupportedKeyTypes

        public void setSupportedKeyTypes​(List<String> supportedKeyTypes)
        Assigns the key types that this container supports. The default is DEFAULT_SUPPORTED_KEY_TYPES.
        Specified by:
        setSupportedKeyTypes in interface PkiCredentialContainer
        Parameters:
        supportedKeyTypes - a list of supported key types

      • getProvider

        protected Provider getProvider()
        Gets the security provider used by the container.
        Returns:
        the provider

      • getKeyGeneratorFactory

        protected KeyPairGeneratorFactory getKeyGeneratorFactory​(String keyTypeName)
                                                  throws NoSuchAlgorithmException
        Gets a KeyPairGeneratorFactory that can be used to generate key pairs given the supplied keyTypeName.
        Parameters:
        keyTypeName - the key type name
        Returns:
        a KeyPairGeneratorFactory
        Throws:
        NoSuchAlgorithmException - if no match is found
